messages.message:
<!here> :rotating_light: *ATTENTION!* It’s time we move on from GCP — for real this time! Please partner with me on this journey :upside_down_face:

Attached is a monthly cost breakdown by GCP project:
• *[$8/month] `instabase-for-external-users`*
    ◦ This project will be gone by the end of this week — that's a burrito saved :burrito: (though maybe not in SF :smile:)
• *[$1,890/month] `instabase-dev`* 
    ◦ This must be shut down by the end of next week. That's enough to feed half of Instabase with burritos :burrito::burrito:
    ◦ If you'd like to _keep_ this project, *please respond to this thread ASAP* — otherwise, it's going away
• *[$6,652/month] `instabase-main`* 
    ◦ Targeting *mid-May* for shutdown. This means completing the GCP :arrow_right: AWS migration for `platform.instabase.com (http://platform.instabase.com)`
    ◦ I’ll own this one! Burritos for everyone :burrito::burrito::burrito: — SF or not :smile:
• *[$8,594/month] `instabase-build`*
    ◦ Still running a devtools K8s cluster. I'd like to delete it *by the end of next week*. @Cody Boggs — please prioritize this
    ◦ Additional cleanup will need an assessment, especially around relocating Docker images
• *[$8,774/month] `instabase-public`*
    ◦ Requires an assessment. This is where Docker images for on-prem customers are stored — we’ll need a careful purge strategy
    ◦ I’ll take ownership of this one
:triangular_flag_on_post: Please flag _any concerns_ immediately. Thank you! :pray:

_and in case you haven't noticed, I do love a burrito! cheers!_

I think `instabase-build` is about ready for teardown - aside from the base images, which are frankly a bit of an enigma.

That said, the GKE cluster is effectively dead and done AFAIK, so that'll be on my list for tomorrow if I can muster the strength. lol
Let's work together on the base images. I like enigmas

Heh sounds good
mostly it's down to some "interesting" makefile machinations that I haven't sat down to reverse engineer, but we can figure that out with some dedicated focus I think. And get it all streamlined into ECR too lol
